719862f-a.text:
Fort Washington Park: A View showing Manhattan's only lighthouse nestling beneath the George Washington Bridge. This sets on a promontory formerly known as Jeffery's Hook. A moon shaped battery, built here in 1775, overlooked the spot where ships were sunk to obstruct the British fleet during the American
Revolution.
October 21, 1938
George D. Chinn
719862f-a.title: Manhattan: Fort Washington Park - [Lighthouse.]
